main event: A circular object the size of a dime approached from the north at a high rate of speed, passed overhead, and disappeared to the south.
interesting points: The sighting occurred at 0250 on March 25, 1957., The observation lasted less than one minute., The sighting was made under thin broken clouds at night., The object was visually confirmed as it passed overhead., The report suggests that this object was very probably a meteor.
witness description: civilian, Mr. Sheriff of San Bernardino
